720545f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Leroy Street
720545f-a.text:
420-436 Hudson Street, east side, between Leroy (right) and Morton (left)
Streets, as seen through clearance on the west side (former site of the
Mirror Candy Company Building).
March 28, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720545f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Leroy Street, Manhattan, NY

723100f-a.title: Manhattan: St. Lukes Place - Hudson Street
723100f-a.text:
2, 3 to 13 St. Luke's Place, north side, adioining and east of
Hudson Street, seen from Hudson Park on the south side. St. Luke's
Place is the eastern extension of Leroy Street cut through the
Trinity Church Cemetery in the 1840's. That part of the Trinity
Church Farmi on the east side of Hudson Street, from Clarkson to
Morton Streets, Was early set aside for a cemetery. After Leroy
Street was cut through, the southern half continued to serve as a
cemetery until the 1890's, when the bodies were moved up to the
cemetery on upper Broadway, and the old cemetery converted into
a park, called St. John's Park (not to be confused with St. John's
Park on lower Varick Street), later Hudson Park, and opened to the
public in 1898.
The northern half was promptly built up, and a little later named
St. Luke's Place, with its own set of house numbers, which replaced
the odd numbers 99-ol Leroy Street. Nos. 1-2 age the side of
420 Hudson Street, the corner building. No. 4ds, at the time of
this picture, the residence of Mayor James J. Wilker.
March 9, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
2-St. Lukea Plece, north side, in foregtound, entrance ~9 ggol5
P. L. 5err  Weptember 24, 1938
NO REPRCDUCTIONS
3-St. Lukek Place, north sidr, from Nudson Street, looking
westward.
P. L. Sperr  eptember 24, 1938

720543f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Leroy Street
720543f-a.text:
Hudson Street, at the N.E. corner of Leroy Street. Also shown (aoross
clearance), is Leroy Street, at the S.E. corner of Greervich Street.
March 28, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720544f-b.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Leroy Street
720544f-b.text:
(1)
Edson Street, west side, north from Lerey Street. Note demolition
between Laroy and Morton Streets.
February 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A closer view of demolition.
February 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The sawe as No. 2; at a later date, and showing site cleared.
March 28, 1936.
P. L. S9err.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720900f-a.title: Manhattan: Leroy Street - Hudson Street
720900f-a.text:
109, 107, 105-103 Leroy Street, west of, adjoining and at
N.W. corner of Hudson Street. No. 105-103 is the side of 423
Street, the corner building. No. 107 is the little old house
the dormer windows.
June 3, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720900f-a.folder: Leroy Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720540f-b.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Leroy Street
720540f-b.text:
(1)
Hudson Street,East side,south from and including Clarkson
Street. At this point we are looking back on the business
section of Hudson Street;from this point Horth it is still
largely a residential,(if somewhat slummy), district,as
it was south of here prior to the building operations of
the I92O's.
June I5,I930.
(2) Hudson Street,East Side,southward from Leroy Street clearing
between Clarkson and Houston Streets.
October 2nd,I938
Photographs by,
P.L.Sperr,
No Reproductions.
720540f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Leroy Street, Manhattan, NY
